title: Religious diversity in Middle East/North Africa in 2010 , by religion
summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Percentage of population for 5 number of Religions.
The Percentage of population is appeared to be the highest at Religion Muslims and lowest at Religion Unaffiliated.
There is a difference of 92.0 between the maximum Religion Muslims and minimum Religion Unaffiliated.
min_summary: This is a bar chart representing Religion in the x axis and Percentage of population in the y axis.
The Percentage of population is appeared to be the highest at Religion Muslims and lowest at Religion Unaffiliated.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Percentage of population for 5 number of Religions.
The Percentage of population is appeared to be the highest at Religion Muslims and lowest at Religion Unaffiliated.
There is a difference of 92.0 between the maximum Religion Muslims and minimum Religion Unaffiliated.
max_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Percentage of population for 5 number of Religions.
Religion Muslims has the highest Percentage of population and Unaffiliated has the lowest Percentage of population.
Religion Unaffiliated has 93.0 times less Percentage of population than Religion Muslims which is the highest.
Religion Muslims is higher than any other Religions with value 93.0, followed by Christians, and Jews. Down to Religion Unaffiliated with the lowest value 1.0.
Religion Unaffiliated, and Hindus have the same Percentage of population.
The lowest value 1.0 at Unaffiliated is almost 4.6 times smaller than the average value 20.2.
Summing up the values of all Religions, we get total 101.0.
